intro: Cuspidaria emmonsii, commonly known as the Emmons' cuspidaria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, and often branched leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
